PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O cвncer й uma doenзa que afeta a cada ano milhхes de pessoas ao redor do mundo. PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: HIGH PERFORMANCE NUMERICAL SIMULATION OF REACTIVE FLOW IN INERT POROUS MEDIA
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: HIGH PERFORMANCE NUMERICAL SIMULATION OF REACTIVE FLOW IN INERT POROUS MEDIA Processo: CCGI ? PROBRAL? 265/07 applications of theoretical studies conducted at LCFT/ITA to practical problems appearing in the innovative technologies being investigated at LSTM, in the area of Flows with Chemical Reactions. Mathematical modeling and numerical simulations carried out at LCFT/ITA, which deal with macroscopic modeling of flow in permeable media, will be extended to include the capability to simulate reactive flows in advanced porous combustors so that comparisons with measurements taken at LSTM on such apparatuses will be carried out. Simulations will involve high performance computing technologies in order to more realistically simulate flow and heat transfer in such equipment. Accordingly, LCFT/ITA was chosen to be of the nodes for the recently established Scientific Computing Network funded by the PETROBRAS Company in Brazil. As such, one can see here a clear match of interests and capabilities, extending the mathematical tools developed at ITA to optimize engineering equipment designed and fully tested at LSTM. Additionally, large efforts were made at the LSTM during the last decade to develop the software package FASTEST3D, which can be used to simulate flows in porous media. Based on a homogenization approach for the solid material it is currently possible to simulate the flow behaviour, taking into account chemical reactions and radiation. In summary, this project deals with a consistent program of studies on simulation of flow, heat and mass transfer in porous reactors using a cluster of computers, detailed chemistry, advanced physical and numerical modeling for more realistic predictions of released heat and mass concentration formation. Applications shall involve both optimization of heat generating equipment developed at LSTM, burning fuel-lean mixtures, as well as novel hydrogen production reactors, which make use of fuel-rich streams. U

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Este projeto tem como objetivo a anбlise experimental e numйrica de escoamento com reaзхes quнmicas. O modelo matemбtico baseia-se na formulaзгo macroscуpica do transporte da quantidade de movimento, do transporte das espйcies quimicas envolvidas em meios porosos juntamente com o transporte de energia em meios porosos considerando um desequilibro tйrmico, ou seja, utilizando-se de duas equaзхes macroscуpicas de energia: uma para o fluido e outra pra o sуlido sem considerar o equilнbrio tйrmico local. Em resumo, este projeto tem o intento de avaliar experimentalmente e numericamente o transporte da quantidade de movimento, calor e massa em meios porosos a fim de se obter um modelo matemбtico que represente com maior fidelidade o transporte de um fluido reativo em meios permeбveis.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper reports a numerical study of the Soret effect on steady-state flows, which are induced by double-diffusion in an enclosure. Convection takes place in a square cavity filled with a porous medium. Horizontal walls are impermeable and Subjected to a vertical gradient of temperature. Vertical surfaces are adiabatic and Subjected to a horizontal gradient of concentration. The physical model for momentum conservation equation makes use of the Forchheimer extension of the classical Darcy model. Governing parameters of the problem under study are thermal and solutal Rayleigh (Ra), Buoyancy ratio (N), Lewis numbers (Le) and Soret parameters (M). Computations using the finite-volume method cover the range 100<Ra<1000, -40<M<40 for N=0.1

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este projeto tem como objetivo a anбlise numйrica de alto desenpenho de escoamento com reaзхes quнmicas utilizando o mйtodo Multigrid. O modelo matemбtico baseia-se na formulaзгo macroscуpica do transporte da quantidade de movimento, do transporte das espйcies quimicas envolvidas em meios limpos e/ou meios porosos juntamente com o transporte de energia considerando no caso de um meio poroso um desequilibro tйrmico local, ou seja, utilizando-se de duas equaзхes macroscуpicas de energia: uma para o fluido e outra pra o sуlido sem considerar o equilнbrio tйrmico local. Pretende-se, assim, mapear o comportamento das propriedades macroscуpicas do escoamento reativo e verificar a sua acurбcia em relaзгo aos resultados obtidos atravйs da experimentaзгo em laboratуrio e com outros modelos encontrados na literatura e com os pacotes computacionais FASTEST3D e OPENFOAM, o qual tambйm pode ser usado para anбlise numйrica de escoamento reativo em meios porosos e meios limpos com transporte radiativo de energia. Em resumo, este projeto tem o intento de avaliar numericamente o transporte da quantidade de movimento, calor e massa em meios porosos a fim de se obter um modelo matemбtico que represente com maior fidelidade o transporte de um fluido reativo em meios permeбveis.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Burners are primarily responsible for combustion when it comes to equipment such as ovens, turbines and boilers. In these combustion processes, the use of heavy oils that are normally high in density and low fluidity is frequent. These fuels have difficult mixing and high emission levels when burned. Among the alternatives for the difficulties, the use of rotational flow provides better combustion and the use of biodiesel promotes emission reductions. The objective of this work is to analyze, without presence of reactions or burning, the influence of the air directing geometry at the burner in the biodiesel flow, in order to obtain the maximum dispersion of this fluid and, therefore, to improve the efficiency. The analysis will be done through Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) using the software Ansys CFX 19.0. In the results, the volumetric fraction distributions, the flow trajectory and the Swirl numbers will be evaluated qualitatively and quantitatively. Keywords: Industrial burners. Biodiesel. Swirl. Computational Fluid Dynamics
